page.title: 10OKEHAMPTON - CRAON TWINNING
page.content: Okehampton is twinned with Craon, in N.W. France. The twinning between the two towns was established in 1977. Each year a party of adults go to Craon, and then adults from Craon come here. There is also a pupil exchange organised by the College. French students stay for a fortnight in a family. Students come from Le Prieure, a private Catholic school that is twinned with the College. Exchanges have been arranged between the town bands. There are now very strong links with Craon, a modern connection with Normandy. The president of Craon's twinning association is Madame de Guebriand, who lives in the Chateau de Craon. There is a by-pass round Craon called the Boulevard D'Okehampton. What will our by-pass be called? - when it is built! Sarah Samson
